definition: the act of attaining or gaining access to a new office or right or position (especially the throne), to make a record of additions to a collection, such as a library
details:
noun
- the act of attaining or gaining access to a new office or right or position (especially the throne)
= example: the act of attaining or gaining access to a new office or right or position (especially the throne)
= synonyms: rise to power
- the right to enter
= synonyms: entree
- agreeing with or consenting to (often unwillingly)
= example: agreeing with or consenting to (often unwillingly)
= synonyms: assenting
- something added to what you already have
= example: something added to what you already have
= synonyms: addition
- (civil law) the right to all of that which your property produces whether by growth or improvement
- a process of increasing by addition to a collection or group
= example: a process of increasing by addition to a collection or group
verb
- to make a record of additions to a collection, such as a library
= example: to make a record of additions to a collection, such as a library
